repnme.cdata!:
Sudan - Public Enterprise and Economic
            Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Sudan Public Enterprise and Economic
            Management Project. The project's main objectives
            included (i) establishing a privatization implementation
            unit; (ii) strengthening the supervisory capabilities of the
            Ministry of Finance over public enterprises, (iii) providing
            technical assistance to support the public enterprise reform
            and privatization effort; (iv) designing and implementing a
            restructuring program for a select number of troubled
            strategic public enterprises; and (v) providing training and
            logistical support to facilitate the public enterprise
            reform and privatization effort.  Bank's performance
            was satisfactory. Borrower's performance was not
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i)
            the importance of not exaggerating project objectives, and
            the need to include adequate monitorable actions; and (ii)
            the need to design projects with a clear understanding of
            the political environment. The implementation of a
            privatization or restructuring program in Sudan did not
            adequately take into account political constraints.

repnme.cdata!:
Sudan - Public Enterprise and Economic
            Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of this Public Enterprise
            and Economic Management Project is to restore economic
            growth. This would be accomplished by reforming the public
            enterprise (PE) sector, by improving national plannning and
            financial management, and by improving human resource
            management. In support of these objectives technical
            assistance, supporting services and equipment would be
            provided.  The project would result in the improvement of
            the institutional framework of the PE sector, create
            momentum for rapid expansion of the reform program, render
            the budgetary and planning system more efficient and launch
            a process of improvement of the Government's personnel
            management function.
